Articles.Content:
This is AWESOME!

![EUwRw1f.png](http://i.imgur.com/EUwRw1f.png)
Wait, it costs $40 now!?!
Understandable. It is the full release, and plus, it's on sale for $30. This probably will give you many more hours of entertainment than your average $60 AAA game, so great value.
Congratulations, Squad! Great work! It's been so far...

Yeah, nice "sale" we have going on there ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

The joke is that it used to cost 29.99 anyways.
That is awesome. I thought it was awesome that when you open steam, the whole background is "KSP is fully released!"

Holy smokes, forty bucks!? That's a lot more money than what I paid. What was it, twenty two, twenty three? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

Still under what I would be willing to pay after the enjoyment I've gotten out of the game. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I think that -25% is too little. KSP should be priced at $300 and have a constant -90% sale ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Holy smokes, forty bucks!? That's a lot more money than what I paid. What was it, twenty two, twenty three? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
> Still under what I would be willing to pay after the enjoyment I've gotten out of the game. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Pre-Steam release, ksp even sold as low as $9, I believe. The price goes up as they add features.

Yeah, I paid $23 good ol' dollars for KSP. But there are some out there who paid free.99 for it. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif) (it used to be free)

> 
> Holy smokes, forty bucks!? That's a lot more money than what I paid. What was it, twenty two, twenty three? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
> Still under what I would be willing to pay after the enjoyment I've gotten out of the game. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I paid 25 bucks for my installment. Glad to at least save something.
I think it was either $7 or $8 when I bought it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
It was 27, maybe 26 dollars when I bought it.
I bought it for 18... But the price now is understandable.

Note that this is only the list of cross-platform games. If you go to Windows only, KSP is still #5.

It's still amazingly impressive, especially looking at the titles above it (Star Wars collection? *GTA?*) Way to go Squad and KSP. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Deservedly so!

A whole new audience for my YouTube channel, excellent. =)

> 
> Note that this is only the list of cross-platform games. If you go to Windows only, KSP is still #5.
> It's still amazingly impressive, especially looking at the titles above it (Star Wars collection? *GTA?*) Way to go Squad and KSP. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's a dynamic list. KSP is a "new release" and new releases sell faster than old releases; what really matters is how long it stays in the top 10.

KSP is #1 on GOG.com as well.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T01:18:34Z" title="04/29/2015 01:18  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by Fel**

I got it on a summer/winter sale for 12 I think. Still its worth the 40 or hell even 60+ in my opinion, compared to other games you get now a days for much much more.

Its odd how that works, EU another one of my favorites is similarly priced low, but if you count the hours/enjoyment up, they far far far exceed all the AAA 60+ ($100 NZD for me) games.

> 
> It's a dynamic list. KSP is a "new release" and new releases sell faster than old releases; what really matters is how long it stays in the top 10.
> KSP is #1 on GOG.com as well.

I know, but I'm still impressed. I don't know if the ranking factors in pre-1.0 sales or not, but regardless, it's still selling like crazy.

Nice to see it had a successful launch over at GOG as well!

> 
> I know, but I'm still impressed. I don't know if the ranking factors in pre-1.0 sales or not, but regardless, it's still selling like crazy.
> Nice to see it had a successful launch over at GOG as well!

It's a "per day" thing... I guess I wasn't specific enough.

/me goes to steam to see if I can find sales statistics; I think it only takes ~3000 to get to the top 10 spot but I probably am wrong.

edit... yeah, I don't know where that 3000 came from, I think I derived it somehow (probably a new release vs amount of people playing it)... eitherway, can't find anything to support it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T19:08:57Z" title="04/29/2015 07:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by Fel**
i got it for $27, but I was honestly surprised, my first thoughts when i go ton ksp.com were "well this is probably about 50 bucks"
I think i paid $27, but I got endless entertainment. Find that value anywhere else, I dare you!

Congrats Squad!

<3<3<3

If you paid less than that, big deal. Consider it your reward for discovering KSP before it became mainstream ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ah, gotcha. 

KSP's sales data isn't public, but inferring from Killing Floor 2 (right above) and CS:GO (right below), it's...substantially more than 3000 for KSP specifically. Unless I'm reading the data wrong, which is a definite possibility (getting numbers from steamspy.com)
Lessee. I got a free key for it for steam at some point. Possibly a humble bundle? Or maybe something else. April 2013. Then in August of that year, I bought it for a friend for 23 bucks.

> Pre-Steam release, ksp even sold as low as $9, I believe. The price goes up as they add features.
